sen.j: 節句（せっく）は、伝統的な年中行事を行う季節の節目となる日で日本の文化・風習のこと。
sen.e: "Sekku" (in Chinese characters, written as "節句") means seasonal turning point days when the traditional annual event is held, which is peculiar to Japanese culture and customs.

sen.j: 日本の生活に合わせてアレンジされていくつもの節日が伝わっていたが、そのうちの5つを江戸時代に幕府が公的な行事・祝日として定めたのが節供である。
sen.e: Arranged for the Japanese life, many Sechinichi were handed down to later generations, and during the Edo period, the Tokugawa shogunate designated five of them as the public event day or the national holiday, and this was the beginning of Sekku.
